com.mousebird.maply

Class MarkerInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.BaseInfo
      • com.mousebird.maply.MarkerInfo

  • public class MarkerInfo
extends BaseInfo
    This class holds the visual information for a set of 2D or 3D markers. Rather than have each of those represent their own visual information, we share it here.

    Toolkit users fill this class out and pass it into the addScreenMarkers() or addMarkers() call on the MaplyController.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set the color from a standard Android Color value.
        Parameters:
        color - Color value, including alpha.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float r,
                     float g,
                     float b,
                     float a)
        Set the background color for the markers. If the marker has a texture, this will be multiplied with the texture. Color components range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        r - red
        g - green
        b - blue
        a - alpha

      • setLayoutImportance

        public void setLayoutImportance(float newImport)
        The layout engine controls how text is displayed. It tries to avoid overlaps and takes priority into account. The layout importance controls which markers (or other features) are laid out first. Bigger is more important.

        Defaults to MAXFLOAT, which is off. That means the layout engine does not control the associated markers.

      • setClusterGroup

        public void setClusterGroup(int clusterGroup)
        If greater than -1 we'll sort these markers into cluster groups when zooming out. The number passed in determines which group it's sorted into.
